BOAO Bureau of Oral Armament Oversight • Est. 2019

Threat Index FAQ Report
National Floss Advisory: ELEVATED

You Let Them
Into Your Home.

Twice a day, 327 million Americans voluntarily draw a thin, high-tensile filament across their own vascular tissue. We are the only agency asking why.

Authorized under Executive Order 14,091-F • Pub. L. 118–227

memo_dtetch_2024_final_FINAL.doc

A Message from Deputy Director Tetch

When I was eleven, my older brother Trevor flossed so hard he severed a minor artery in his gumline. He bled into a bathroom sink for four minutes. The paramedics called it "a dental event." I called it what it was: an unsupervised weapons discharge.

I have spent twenty-three years in public service trying to ensure no family experiences what mine did. People laugh. They always laugh. Then I show them the tensile strength data for Oral-B Glide Pro-Health and the laughter stops.

2,200 PSI — tensile breaking strength of standard nylon floss. Piano wire: 2,600 PSI.

situation_room_brief.pdf

What We Know

In fiscal year 2024, Americans purchased 3.2 billion yards of dental floss. Laid end-to-end, that's enough tensile filament to reach the Moon and back six and a half times. No other Category II personal armament enjoys this level of civilian distribution.

It is sold in grocery stores. It is given to children. It comes in flavors.

The BOAO does not find cinnamon-flavored armaments amusing.

compliance_reminder.txt

Are You in Compliance?

As of January 2025, all U.S. residents over the age of 16 must register their floss supply with BOAO. Households possessing more than 200 yards of unregistered floss may be subject to inspection.

If you are a dental professional, you are required to file a Form OA-7: Quarterly Filament Distribution Report with your regional BOAO field office. Failure to file carries a penalty of $4,200 per unreported spool.

Current compliance rate: 3.1% — We are patient.

From the Congressional Record, 118th Congress

"We regulate scissors. We regulate nail files on airplanes. But a garrote-grade filament dispensed from a pastel container shaped like a cartoon tooth? That we hand out in goody bags."
— Deputy Director Marianne Tetch, Senate Subcommittee on Domestic Oral Threats, 2024

Threat Classification Index

Updated quarterly • Last review: Q4 2024

Severe

Oral-B Glide Pro-Health

PTFE-coated. Virtually unbreakable. Slides through enamel checkpoints undetected. The Bureau has requested a voluntary recall fourteen times. Procter & Gamble has not returned our calls.

Severe

Waterpik Whitening Floss

Combines a Category II filament with a chemical bleaching agent. This is, by definition, a binary weapon system. Listed price: $3.49.

High

DenTek Fun Flossers (Kids)

Shaped like dinosaurs. Pre-strung with tensile nylon. Marketed to ages 4+. We find the word "fun" in this context deeply troubling.

High

Listerine Gentle Gum Care

"Gentle" is doing a lot of work here. Rated at 1,900 PSI. The Bureau's definition of "gentle" begins at 0 PSI and ends there.

Moderate

Wooden Toothpicks

A splintering risk, yes, but structurally inferior. The Bureau considers these an acceptable interim solution while the nation transitions to approved interdental tools.

Moderate

Water Flossers

No filament. Pressurized water only. The Bureau's preferred alternative. Deputy Director Tetch uses one exclusively and has described it as "the only honest way to clean your teeth."

Frequently Asked Questions

Citizen inquiry portal

Is dental floss really classified as a weapon? +
Under BOAO Internal Directive 7, any monofilament or braided line with a tensile strength exceeding 800 PSI that is routinely applied to human tissue qualifies as a Category II Personal Armament. Dental floss meets this threshold by a wide margin. We don't make the rules. Actually, we do. We made this one.
My dentist told me to floss more. Is my dentist a threat? +
Your dentist is a licensed medical professional. They are also, under BOAO taxonomy, an unlicensed armament distributor. We understand this is confusing. We are confused too. The interagency memo on this has been in draft since 2021.
I already bought floss. Am I in trouble? +
Possession of registered floss is currently legal in all 50 states. However, we strongly encourage you to file Form OA-3 (Voluntary Self-Declaration of Oral Armament Inventory) with your nearest BOAO field office. Bring a government-issued photo ID and your receipts. Yes, all of them.
What does Deputy Director Tetch's brother think of all this? +
Trevor supports the Bureau's mission. He also hasn't flossed since 1997. The two facts are not unrelated.
Is this real? +
The Bureau of Oral Armament Oversight is as real as the tensile strength of the filament currently sitting in your bathroom drawer. Which is to say: extremely, measurably, dangerously real.

Report Suspicious Flossing

If you witness aggressive, unsupervised, or performative flossing in a public or semi-public setting, contact the BOAO National Tipline.

1-800-FLOSS-TIP
Staffed Monday–Friday, 9AM–4:30PM EST • Closed federal holidays
